From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To destroy a memory chunk or dangling reference, use the **testÂ memory destroy** command in privileged EXEC mode.
CLIs: test memory destroy [ chunk | mgd-chunk | force-chunk | dangling-reference ] <chunk-id>

ParaDef.Info: (Optional) Chunk of memory that is destroyed forcefully.
Address of the chunk to be destroyed.

Examples: In the following example, a chunk of ordinary memory is destroyed:
ExtraInfo: The **force-chunk** keyword destroys a chunk of ordinary (not managed) memory, even if the memory has elements or siblings that are not free.![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/caut.gif)---**Caution** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Use the**force-chunk** keyword carefully. A crash or corruption will occur if someone refers to the destroyed chunk or its elements.---

RelatedCmds.description: Allocates or frees chunk elements from a chunk.
